skill.name: context-driven-development
skill.description: Use this skill when working with Conductor's context-driven development methodology, managing project context artifacts, or understanding the relationship between product.md, tech-stack.md, and workflow.md files.
skill.summary: Treat project context as a managed artifact. Establish structured documentation for product vision, tech stack, and workflows to enable consistent AI interactions and team alignment.
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. SKILL.md is a pure documentation file containing no executable code. The scanner misidentified markdown syntax (backticks for inline code) as shell commands and file extensions (.md) as cryptographic algorithms. No security concerns identified.

medium_findings.title: False Positive: Markdown Code Formatting
medium_findings.description: Scanner flagged 'backtick execution' at lines 178, 193, 233, 252, 256. These are markdown inline code fences (like `/conductor:setup`) used for documentation, not Ruby/shell execution.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Lines contain markdown inline code formatting (backticks) for documentation references, not actual shell commands. This is a documentation-only file.

medium_findings.title: False Positive: Markdown File Extensions as Crypto
medium_findings.description: Scanner flagged 'weak cryptographic algorithm' at lines 3, 26, 48, 180, 201, 242, 269, 282, 330. The scanner misidentified markdown file references (.md) as MD5 cryptographic algorithm.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Lines contain markdown file references like 'product.md' and 'tech-stack.md'. The scanner incorrectly interpreted '.md' as MD5 cryptographic algorithm. No cryptographic code exists.

low_findings.title: False Positive: Documentation Section Misidentified
low_findings.description: Scanner flagged 'system reconnaissance' at line 295. This is a section titled 'Common Anti-Patterns' discussing context management practices.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Line contains documentation about avoiding stale context. No reconnaissance behavior or code execution - pure documentation content.

content.value_statement: Projects lose context between sessions when relying on scattered documentation and ad-hoc prompts. This skill establishes structured context artifacts that persist project knowledge, align teams, and produce consistent AI behavior across all development sessions.
actual_capabilities: Guide the creation and maintenance of project context artifacts including product.md, tech-stack.md, and workflow.md
Establish the Context â†’ Spec & Plan â†’ Implement workflow for consistent AI interactions
Provide validation checklists to verify context accuracy before implementation
Differentiate greenfield and brownfield project setup approaches
Define artifact relationships and synchronization principles across context documents
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly - provides guidance only
Does not integrate with specific IDEs or CI/CD systems
Does not automate context updates - requires manual maintenance
Does not provide templates beyond those described in documentation

use_cases.title: Onboarding to a Conductor Project
use_cases.description: New team members use context artifacts to quickly understand product vision, technology choices, and development practices without asking repetitive questions.
use_cases.target_user: New developers joining an existing team

use_cases.title: Starting a New Project with Structure
use_cases.description: Project leads establish documented context before writing code, creating a foundation that guides all future AI interactions and team decisions.
use_cases.target_user: Technical leads and architects starting new projects

use_cases.title: Maintaining Project Consistency
use_cases.description: Team members follow documented workflows and standards, ensuring consistent code quality and terminology across all contributors regardless of session.
use_cases.target_user: Development teams working with AI assistants

prompt_templates.title: Initial Project Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to start a new project using Conductor's context-driven development methodology. Please help me create the initial context artifacts including product.md, tech-stack.md, and workflow.md. Ask me questions about the product vision, technology preferences, and development practices.
prompt_templates.scenario: Setting up a new project with structured context from scratch

prompt_templates.title: Documenting Existing Project
prompt_templates.prompt: I have an existing codebase. Help me extract implicit context by analyzing our code, configurations, and existing patterns. Create the Conductor context artifacts based on what you discover.
prompt_templates.scenario: Migrating an existing project to context-driven development

prompt_templates.title: Validating Context Before Work
prompt_templates.prompt: Before I start work on this track, please review all context artifacts (product.md, tech-stack.md, workflow.md) and validate that they are current. Flag any outdated information and propose updates.
prompt_templates.scenario: Ensuring context accuracy before implementation begins

prompt_templates.title: Updating Context After Completion
prompt_templates.prompt: I just completed a feature track. What context artifacts should I update to reflect the new capabilities? Please help me update product.md with the completed feature and any scope changes, and verify tech-stack.md if new dependencies were added.
prompt_templates.scenario: Keeping context synchronized with completed work

output_examples.input: Help me set up a new Python web API project
output_examples.output:
Before we begin, let's establish your project context using Conductor's methodology. I'll need to understand:

1. Product Vision: What problem does this API solve? Who are the target users?
2. Technology: Have you chosen a framework (FastAPI, Flask, Django)? Any specific libraries?
3. Workflow: Do you follow TDD? What testing standards? Git conventions?

Once we document these in product.md, tech-stack.md, and workflow.md, I can provide consistent assistance throughout development.

output_examples.input: What context do I need to review before starting?
output_examples.output:
For this track, review these artifacts:

**Essential:**
- conductor/product.md (Product vision, features, target users)
- conductor/tech-stack.md (Dependencies, versions, tools)
- conductor/workflow.md (Practices, quality gates, conventions)

**For tracking:**
- conductor/tracks.md (Current work status)

Check if any context is outdated before proceeding. Let me know if you need me to review specific sections.

Great work completing authentication! Here are the context updates to make:

**Required updates:**
1. product.md: Move authentication from 'planned features' to 'implemented'
2. tech-stack.md: Add any auth libraries used (with versions)
3. tracks.md: Mark this track as complete

**Optional updates:**
- product-guidelines.md: Add error message conventions for auth failures
- workflow.md: Note any testing requirements specific to auth

Would you like me to help draft these updates?

best_practices: Read all context artifacts before starting any track. Validate accuracy and flag outdated information before proceeding with implementation.
Update context artifacts incrementally as part of each track completion process. Small, frequent updates prevent stale documentation.
Commit context changes alongside code changes to preserve the history of how and why decisions were made.
anti_patterns: Letting context become stale by only updating it during major milestones instead of with each feature completion.
Scattering information across multiple unofficial documents instead of using the defined artifact structure.
Relying on implicit knowledge that exists only in team members' heads instead of capturing decisions in context artifacts.

faq.question: What is context-driven development?
faq.answer: Context-driven development treats project context as a managed artifact alongside code. Instead of relying on scattered documentation or re-explaining context in each AI session, you establish structured artifacts that persist project knowledge, technology choices, and workflows.

faq.question: What files make up a Conductor project?
faq.answer: A Conductor project includes product.md (product vision and goals), tech-stack.md (dependencies and tools), workflow.md (development practices), product-guidelines.md (communication standards), and tracks.md (work unit registry). These link through an index.md navigation hub.

faq.question: How often should I update context artifacts?
faq.answer: Update context artifacts as part of each track completion. When a feature finishes, update product.md to reflect new capabilities. When adding dependencies, update tech-stack.md. Small, incremental updates prevent documentation from becoming stale and misleading.

faq.question: How does this help with AI consistency?
faq.answer: AI assistants produce consistent outputs when working from the same context. Instead of re-explaining your tech stack, coding standards, and workflows in every session, the documented context ensures aligned behavior across all interactions and team members.

faq.question: How do I handle existing projects without context?
faq.answer: Run /conductor:setup with existing codebase detection. The system analyzes code, configurations, and documentation to extract implicit context. Review and refine the generated artifacts to establish your context foundation.

faq.question: What if context becomes outdated?
faq.answer: Use the context validation checklist before starting major work. Flag outdated information immediately. Update context as part of each track completion. If context feels wrong, investigate and update rather than working around it.
